dialogues.text: Did you sleep with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sleep--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is, Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me how my personal life in any way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because when it's the President, it's not personal. Sydney, I hired your reputation. I hired a pit bull, not a prom queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unfair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredibly unfair. But you've spent a lot of time over the year telling me the trouble with the environmental lobby is that we don't understand the fundamental truth that politics is perception. This is a bad time to develop ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making way too much of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? This is your time, Sydney. You're sitting at the grown-ups' table. You have a chance to get everything you want -- run a national campaign, be a major player inside the party. But this relationship had better go all the way, because with the leader of the free world there is no halfway. Politics is perception, and if thing don't work out, the amount of time it'll take you to go from being a hired gun to a cocktail party joke can be clocked with an egg timer. There's a quick knock at the door -- Leo's SECRETARY step with a strange-looking package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo, there is no relationship. It was one night. It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Solomon, this was just delivered by White House messenger. It's marked "Perishable."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White House has sent me something perishable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for Ms. Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go... SYDNEY begins unwrapping the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Leo. I'm sure it's just a formality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he had some staff flunky send me a fruit basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrote the note himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he didn't take the time to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The messenger said he was waiting in the Oval Office for ten minutes while the President wrote the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen, so he-- (to LEO'S SECRETARY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it took him ten minutes to write a card?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently he went through several drafts. SYDNEY can't stifle her laugh -- she sees what the gift i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it...what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sent me a Virginia ham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dig it, Ms. Wade. You're the President's girlfriend. SYDNEY's smile fades away...she looks at LEO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's never an egg timer around when you need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the white-gloved MARINE snaps the door open for SYDNEY and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD is conferring with LEWIS and ROBIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they're gonna be pressing today about whether the White House is prepared to soften the assault weapons section of the crime bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no need to entertain that at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want me to handle the Sydney issue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sydney issue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have a consensus on how the White House is going to handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope the Sydney issue refers in some way to a problem we're having with Australia, because if it's anything else... JANIE pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, Ms. Wade is here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she can come right in. I'm finished here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS and ROBIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Sydney issue. SYDNEY enters, crossing paths with LEWIS and ROBIN. They exchange pleasantries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SHEPHERD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for seeing me on such short notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Did you get the ham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the ham, yes. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to send you flowers, but there seem to be some kinks in the system. I'm really glad you stopped by. I had such a good time last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I. It's just that... JANIE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're 45 seconds away, sir. During the following, JANIE will go to the desk, pick up briefing books and stick them in a briefcase and gather u his things -- all without interrupting the conversation a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm delivering a luncheon speech at the Governor's Conference this morning. I'm sorry to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, that's fine. I just stopped by to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you free for dinner tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casual. In the Residence. Without the United Nations. My daughter'll be with us, so it may seem like the United--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to meet Lucy, but... An AIDE has slipped in and hands SHEPHERD a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading to himself as he talks SYDNEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna like you. (calling to the AIDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I have some concerns that-- The AIDE (JEFF) steps back in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the note)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which? Robbins or Stackhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either one. I have to be in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Governor Stackhouse said he just needed 10 minutes. I think he wants to talk about the assault weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stackhouse wants to talk about grazing rights. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. And he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sydney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. You have concerns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Not many. A few. One. I have one concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it having anything to do with one of us being the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to make jokes about this, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not mocking you, honest. I'm just a guy asking a girl over for a meal. And, as if from out of nowhere, a LOUD CLAAAMMERING, like sound of a jackhammer against cement, comes from somewher outside -- growing louder and closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ride's here. And, sure enough, coming into view outside the windows of Oval Office, is MARINE-1, the President's helicopter. JAN comes back in and helps him on with his coat and scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo Solomon has serious concerns about my exploring a social, you know, scenario, with the President of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, when you put it that way, it doesn't sound that great to me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have dinner with Lucy and me. It's meat loaf night -- how presidential can it be? As SHEPHERD rushes out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty. SYDNEY now stands alone in the OVAL OFFICE, trying to fig out what just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine 1 lifting off the south lawn. TILT DOWN off night to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room designed more for comfort than for show, with its overstuffed couches. Lucy enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Ms. Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad told me to tell you he's on the phone with his dentist and that I should behave myself and entertain you till he gets here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's on the phone with his dentist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He told me to tell you he's on the phone with his dentist. He wants you to think he's a regular guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he on the phone with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prime Minister of Israel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're probably not discussing his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're talking about that abbreviation I can never remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capricorn Surface To Air Defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. SHEPHERD enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let meat loaf night begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything all right with your teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dentist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. I've got a cavity in my upper bicuspid region.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a short-range weapons system outside Tel Aviv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LUCY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen limos and town cars line this suburban Maryland street, their drivers waiting patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cocktail party is underway. This is a fat cat fundraise for the Republicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over-thinking this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look and feel of old money. Rumson is holding court w a half-dozen political insiders. Some smoke cigars; other sip their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voters aren't interested in how to achieve economic growth, and they don't want to hear our plans to strengthen foreign policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it comes down to character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press like him, Senator. The networks, the newspapers, they're--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters like him. Networks and newspapers like ratings and circulation. For all the bitching we do about liberal bias in the press when it comes down to a character debate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press is an unwitting accomplice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, the character debate didn't work out for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it couldn't. Our polling told us that attacking his character less than a year after he'd lost his wife was gonna be a turn-off and was gonna make people feel sorry for him. We couldn't run the campaign we wanted because the opponent was a widower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still a widower. Time's passed, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the rest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to forgive my friend. He's been on a hunting trip and cut off from the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? And four STAFFERS grab whatever newspaper is closest to t hand and toss them to CARL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President's got a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY, SHEPHERD and SYDNEY are finishing up a game of Scra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LUCY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad says you're studying the Constitutional Convention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not having any fun, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a nightmare. This is a social studies nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're doing a mock Congress. Each kid is playing one of the original delegates, and they debate the Amendments. Now what's not fun about that? LUCY gets up from the table and kisses her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you, Mrs.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you, Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well, honey. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too. LUCY leaves. SHEPHERD and SYDNEY are alone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's you. After a pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like the 25-cent tour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the "museum" area of the White House, the part yo see when you take the official tour. Only a few lights ar lit, and while the SECRET SERVICE AGENTS give SHEPHERD pl of breathing room when he's in the residence, we'll still catch a glimpse of one of them rounding a corner in the distance or checking a doorway ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought C-STAD wasn't gonna be operational until January.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was ready ahead of schedule. We've just been waiting for the personnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Israelis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, our guys. We've sent a team of Army instructors to train the Israelis. SYDNEY and SHEPHERD enter the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Named for its beautiful glass display cases featuring ful place settings of the official White House china and silverware from every administration since Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is the dish room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the dish--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. It's the room with all the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the China Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm more of a West Wing President. If you're curious about the mansion, there's probably a book you can get--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There're about seven-thousand books. I'll get one for you. SYDNEY's been walking slowly around the room, looking at display cases, and as she gets near one of the large wind she takes another step which drapes her in a shaft of incredibly flattering moonlight. The vision isn't lost on SHEPHERD. They stare at each oth for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President -- have you ever noticed how similar the Van Buren flatware is to the Buchanan flatware?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think there will ever come a time when you can stand in a room with me and not think of me as the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a state of mind. You are the President. And when I'm in a room with you, oval or any other shape, I'm always gonna be a lobbyist, and you'll always be the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got news for you, Sydney. As a lobbyist, you would never be alone in a room with the President. This last statement is not lost on SYDNEY. He moves toward her until they are both bathed in the moonlight. He puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. They lean in to kiss each other. They barely make contact when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President... An AGENT is standing in the doorway -- SHEPHERD and SYDNE break apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a secure call from the sit- room. SHEPHERD knows what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He moves out the door and into the corridor. SYDNEY, knowing something's wrong, instinctively moves to follow him and be with him, but the AGENT hasn't moved fr the doorway, so--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...of course. SHEPHERD comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we're going to have to cut our evening short. The Libyans have just bombed C-STAD. I'll try to call you tomorrow. (to the AGENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you show Ms. Wade out. SHEPHERD exits. SYDNEY, alone for a second in the dish room, is finally approached by a SECRET SERVICE AGENT, who starts to escor her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The response scenario's in place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD, A.J., the SECRETARY OF STATE, the SECRETARY OF DEFENSE, and about a dozen or so Pentagon, Security Counc and Joint Chiefs OFFICIALS are doing exactly what they're trained for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The F-18's are fired up on the Kimitz and the Kitty Hawk. They're just waiting for your attack order, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're gonna hit Libyan Intelligence Headquarters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The N.S.A. confirmed they're the ones who planned the bombing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the estimate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll level the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Libyan I.H.Q's in the middle of downtown Tripoli -- are we gonna hit anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if we miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we gonna miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people work in that building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been all through--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people work in the damn building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got those number here. There are three shifts, so it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fewest. What shift puts the fewest people in the building? The night shift, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By far. Mostly custodial staff and a few--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time does the night crew go on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's immediate, it's decisive, it's low risk, and it's a proportional response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday somebody's going to have to explain to me the virtue of a proportional response. There's a SILENCE. SHEPHERD gets up and starts to head ou the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD is with A.J., LEWIS, ROBIN, KODAK and a couple o AIDES, all of whom look as though they've been called out their homes in the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, as soon as our planes have cleared Libyan airspace, you can call the press. I don't know when we'll have the full B.D.A.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Rork says around O-Eight Hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, what do you think about a national address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I want to do is put the Lybians center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a great idea, sir. You know Rumson's gonna be talking about your lack of military service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about Rumson. What I did tonight was not about political gain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it can be, sir. What you did tonight was very presidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon, somewhere in Libyan right now there's a janitor working the night shift at the Libyan Intelligence Headquarters. He's going about his job 'cause he has no idea that in about an hour he's gonna die in a massive explosion. He's just going about his job 'cause he has no idea that an hour ago I gave an order to have him killed. You just saw me do the least presidential thing I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President...Mr. President!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD is at the podium taking questions. He's flanked his PENTAGON STAFF. A.J. and LEWIS stand to the side. ROB stands out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything at all about the C-STAD weapons system that could have been mistaken by Libyan Intelligence as offensive rather than defensive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We did everything but show them the blueprints. The hardware was sitting in a airplane hangar for a month. They didn't hit it until the American personnel got there. Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there's an unconfirmed report that you were with Sydney Wade when you learned of the attack. Can you comment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to ROBIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we'd just finished dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, would you care to comment on the status of your relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a relationship. We just had dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell us if she spent the night at the White House or did--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, a lot of people got killed last night. Let's try to keep our eyes on the ball, okay? SHEPHERD is herded out of the briefing room amidst a chor of "Mr. President" 's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD walks away from the briefing room with ROBIN. JA joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my fault, sir. We should have prepped you for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing that needs prepping. A.J., let's meet with the leadership after we meet with the Security Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Newsweek" is begging for ten minutes today. Any ten minutes you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody gets ten minutes today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD sits at his desk, is on the phone. A TELEVISION NEWSCAST is doing a report on Congressional reaction to t events of the day. ROB RUMSON is talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis, tell the speaker to wait. I want to talk to him. No, I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Last night, the price of his liberal programs was raised to include the blood of 22 American soldiers. He hangs up. On the TV, we see a quick sound bite from RU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mr. Shepherd's read a lot of books, but you didn't need a Harvard degree to see this comin' a mile down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to Stanford, you blowhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fat that our Commander-in-Chief has not served one day in uniform-- SHEPHERD clicks off the TV and then stares at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This box just says "Miscellaneous." Is this bedroom miscellaneous or kitchen miscellaneous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY and BETH have been getting SYDNEY moved in. BETH i holding a carton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I have to kiss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kissed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't' tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kissed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the White House?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dish room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dish room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The China Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to go and attack Libya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta nip this in the bud. This has catastrophe written all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what language?! Sydney, this man is the leader of the free world. He's brilliant, he's funny, he's handsome, and he's an above-average dancer. Isn't it possible our standards are just a tad high? The PHONE RINGS-- SYDNEY freezes. The PHONE RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna ask me to come over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. But I'm gonna end it on the phone. I'm not gonna go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD opens his door, revealing SYDNEY. Agent COOPER i letting her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came over here to tell you why I can't see you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to COOPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Coop. SHEPHERD closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you've had a tough day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as tough as some. You want a drink? Lemme take your coat. But SYDNEY doesn't take her coat off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, this isn't gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it will. You button the top button, and it doesn't fall off the hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've really enjoyed the time we've spent together, but this has catastrophe written all over it. Please, Mr. President, don't pursue me outside the political arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have no intention of pursuing you inside the political arena, so that leaves everything out, and that's unacceptable to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were on your staff, I would tell you that the absolute worst thing you can do coming into an election year is to open yourself up to character attacks, and the fastest way to do that is to prance around like the playboy of the Western world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's clear up a couple of things. Number 1: I seldom prance. Number 2: I have no intention of engaging in a character debate, and Number 3: You're not on my staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, but if you'll follow the immutable--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you on my staff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't afford me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you do, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name's Andy. How much money do you make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does it matter how much money I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would raise your voice to the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only thinking about the health of your Presidency. You think this morning's press conference was the end of it? Bob Rumson's gotta be drooling over this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you attracted to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked if--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of course she is)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the issue--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I tell you what. Let's make it the issue. Let's try something new, 'cause I know that most couples, when they're first getting together, are inclined to slam on the brakes because they're concerned about Bob Rumson's drool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not most people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what your problem is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex and nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex and nervousness is my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Last night when we were looking at the different place settings in the dish room, I realized that those place settings were provided by the First Ladies. And I'll bet none of those First Ladies were nervous about having sex with their President husbands. And you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm sure you'll explain it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Because they weren't presidents when they met them. Not the case here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what I'm getting at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. May I use your bathroom for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's right through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to freshen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you pass through, you'll see a large closet on your left. And if you feel comfortable, hang up your coat, and when you come back I'll have fixed up a drink, we'll sit on the couch, and I will explain to you my plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a plan? Don't make me wait. You're on a roll. SYDNEY disappears into the BATHROOM/DRESSING ROOM area. SHEPHERD keeps talking as he goes to the bar and makes a couple of drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're attracted to me, but the idea of physical intimacy is uncomfortable because you only know me as the President. It's not always gonna be that way, and the reason I know that is because there was a moment last night when you were with me and not the President, and I know what a big step that was for you. So, Sydney, I'm in no rush. Here's my plan: We're gonna slow down. When you're comfortable, that's when it'll happen. SYDNEY comes back into the room...she's wearing one of SHEPHERD's dress shirts and nothing else. She walks towar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I didn't properly explain the fundamentals of the "Slow Down" plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You explained it great. She moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. My nervousness exists on several levels. Number 1 -- and this is in no particular order -- I haven't done this in a pretty long time. Number 2: Any expectations you might have, due to the fact that I'm, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most powerful man in the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, thank you. Just so you remember that's a political distinction that comes with the office. I mean, if Eisenhower were here instead of me he'd be dead by now. And number three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy... They're both standing, facing each other... They gently kiss. They just stay with it until it becomes easier and better and exactly what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does New Hampshire want traditional American values back in the White House?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of 300 or so is being whipped into a frenzy. Rumson's bringing it home under a campaign banner proclaiming: THE PRIDE IS BACK -- BOB RUMSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does New Hampshire want the pride back? The CROWD goes nuts upon hearing Rumson's signature phras

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Bob Rumson. And I'm running for President. And as the CROWD loses its mind, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very early, and SHEPHERD is still asleep. As we PUL BACK, WE REVEAL that he is alone in his bed. The PHONE RI SHEPHERD picks it up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...put him through. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis, it is 5:00 a.m. You gotta get yourself a life, man. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...all right. He hangs up the phone and looks around the room, only to notice SYDNEY is tiptoeing around in the dim light, tryin to quietly dress herself and gather up her things. SHEPHE watches this odd spectacle for a moment before he says--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney? SYDNEY turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to leave the building before the press corps got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have those same thoughts every day of my life. Say, you know Lewis Rothschild, don't you? Well, he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Boy, Lewis'd go nuts if he knew I'd spent the night. There's a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on his way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in, Lewis. LEWIS comes in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning, Mr. President. Hi, Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lewis. Well, Mr. President, thank you for taking the time to go over those fossil fuel numbers. I'll just get my coat, and be on my way. SHEPHERD laughs at SYDNEY's purposely lame try--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're camped out at every exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who's camped out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press is camped out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoulda taken a cab, Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know my car?! ROBIN enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. President. Hi, Sydney. I came over as soon as Lewis called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the important thing is not to make it look like we're panicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, and I think the important thing is actually not to be panicking. A.J. KNOCKS on the open door and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. President. Good morning, Ms. Wade. I see everyone's getting an early start today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we exit Sydney from the building and what do we say to the press at that point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand that by diversion I'm not saying we set the White House on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, let's do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I state very clearly that I can't be party to anything illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you, Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what you want, but it's always the guy in my job that ends up doing eighteen months in Danbury Minimum Security Prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest easy, Lewis. We're not creating a diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SYDNEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have somebody take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esther's over in my office. She's got the station wagon outside. SHEPHERD regards A.J. for a moment...clearly the man plan ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. Now, the press statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SYDNEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney, when you leave here, you're gonna run into reporters and photographers. Your picture's gonna be taken every day, and you're gonna be asked questions every day. Answer them, don't answer them -- it's entirely up to you. The White House has no official position except to say "no comment."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White House doesn't comment on the President's personal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just leave it at that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what, Lewis, we just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the meeting's over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. President. LEWIS, ROBIN and A.J. say their "Thank you, Mr. President on the way out ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney. Esther'll be in my office. You take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, A.J. A.J. leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about all this. We'll do it better next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no expert, but I thought we did it pretty good this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. I'll call you. I'll be in Panama, but I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that. SYDNEY gives him a good-bye kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. She exits the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right...okay...this is good.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: AS we move through a series of quick DISSOLVES, all M.O.S we HEAR in VOICE-OVER the sounds of American's electronic media -- network news, news magazines, gossip shows, talk radio, political round tables, etc. -- dissecting the "Girlfriend Factor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY and the TEAM are in full gear. Lisa rips off anoth vote on the tote board, making it "14 Votes in 51 Days."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney Ellen Wade, the political strategist who accompanied President Shepherd to last week's state dinner, reportedly spent the night at the White House as a guest of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tote board reads "8 Votes in 45 Days." KODAK is point to a spot on an electoral map to emphasize a point to a y INTERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President returned from Panama this evening after a three-day tour through Central America. His first order of business: An intimate supper with Sydney Wade at a romantic Georgetown bistro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD and SYDNEY are sharing what seems to be an intim candlelit dinner. We PULL BACK TO REVEAL a restaurant pac with SECRET SERVICE, and PRESS outside police barricades, shooting through the windows of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conservative and religious family organizations are starting to smell blood in the water as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is giving a little trombone recital for SHEPHERD and SYDNEY. SYDNEY cheers madly at the end of the piece, givi Lucy a big hug for her effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, caller, you're on the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, what about Lucy Shepherd? Is anyone concerned about this little girl? Can we now finally have a serious debate about family values?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY exits her apartment and is once again hounded by t press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna take a commercial break. When we come back, we're gonna meet a junior high school classmate of Sydney Wade's, who says--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumson's getting the pride back into a couple of hundred innocent bystanders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Showbiz Weekly was in Hollywood for the star-studded gala. Also on tonight's program: Day 15 of the Sydney Watch. Is the world's most eligible bachelor off the market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY exits the building and is mobbed by the press. JOHN McLAUGHLIN TYPE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Political polling analyst Ed Earl, with the President's job approval taking an eight-point dip from his personal best of 63 percent three weeks ago, should the White House be concerned that the Girlfriend Factor has left Shepherd vulnerable to the kinds of character questions he was able to avoid three years ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if they're not concerned, they sure oughta be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBIN is hearing a question she's been asked 88 times already. She keeps her cool as best she can and merely shrugs her shoulders and shakes her head "no." JOHN McLAUGHLIN TYPE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Columnist Cynthia Skyler, how much will this new wrinkle affect his ability to put together a win on his crime bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of the Ramada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumson and his STAFF are buzzing about amid room service tables and late-night take-out as STU enters the room wit a manila envelope in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree a hundred and ten percent, Mrs. Harper. That's why I'm up here in the dead of winter talkin' about it with you folks. Rumson is signaling for an AIDE to take over his phone ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very generous of you, ma'am, and I'm gonna take that money off your hands right now. He hands off the phone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got for me, Stu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Santa Claus, Senator. Several TOP AIDES join this slightly confidential convers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got an FBI file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Stu, my mother's got an FBI file. RUMSON starts to walk away when STU pulls an 8$B!_(J10 the manila folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got art. RUMSON comes back. STU hands him the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a demonstration outside the Department of Commerce. The picture's old, and a lot of the faces are obscured by the smoke, but this is Sydney right there in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man...tell me the smoke is coming from what it looks like it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir -- it's burning flag. RUMSON gives it one last look, passes it back to STU, and turns back to his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few more young INTERNS have been added, and most are ha at work on the phones -- ("___ from the Global Defense Council. We're encouraging voters in your area to phone o write your Congressman regarding...etc.") The tote board now reads "11 Votes in 42 Days." David is supervising things while SYDNEY is trying to lose her patience on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, Congressman...Of course you need to deliberate. I know the fact that there isn't any heavy industry in your district doesn't make this decision any easier. But we met three weeks ago, and at the end of that meeting you said that you were leaning our way but that you wanted to sleep on it. Since I haven't heard from you since then, the only conclusion I can reach is that you haven't slept in 21 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SYDNEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him about his position on stateboard for Hawaii. SYDNEY wads up some paper and flings it at David to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, think like a father for a second. Wouldn't you like your kids to be able to take a deep breath when they're 30? Thank you. You're doing the right thing. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; announcing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tote board's heavy. The room CHEERS, knows what this means. DAVID rips off th 11, revealing 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better! Everyone gets back to work as SYDNEY and DAVID speak amon themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Syd, I saw on your schedule you're gonna meet with McSorley, McCluskey and Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Motown Three said they'd give me 30 minutes next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney, these are people who represent people who make cars for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars, you understand, run on gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know it's a long shot, but if I can get one of them, it'll be a huge payoff in visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we're gonna try, we should do some prep work. You wanna order in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't work tonight. I'm having dinner at the White House. We can start early tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm having lunch at the Kremlin, so we'll have to, you know, start real early...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exciting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in order for me to catch the morning plane to Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President's motorcade sits in its formation, engines running, waiting for its passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANIE and a couple of AIDES are in a familiar routine, do their last-minute scrambling to get the President out the door so that he doesn't fall behind his usual "45-minutes behind-schedule" schedule. SHEPHERD is on the phone at hi desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas, does the N.R.A. have videotapes of you playing golf with Satan? We've already softened the assault weapons. We're leaving the SKS, the mini 14, and about 250 other types on the street. I mean, how much pull can one lobby-- JANIE catches SHEPHERD's eye and makes a subtle gesture t her wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Yeah, look, we're gonna continue this tomorrow. I'm late for the party fund-raiser. I'll be sure and put in a good word for you, by the way. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're incredibly late. They head to door as A.J. enters from the other side of t office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President. I just got off the phone with the Federal Mediator in St. Louis. Management just walked away from the table. The baggage handlers, pilots and flight attendants are getting set to walk in 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I studied under a Nobel-Prize-Winning economist. You know what he taught me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have a airline strike at Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm going to St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can leave straight from the fund- raiser. Janie, get him outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberty's moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD is getting into the limo when LEWIS and ROBIN hu out to catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's incredibly late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS and ROBIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop in. We'll talk in the car. As they do they're told, and the motorcade gets on its wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a small problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meant for LEWIS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could've been a small problem. It's now at the very least a medium- sized--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin sees it as a problem. I see it as a opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could've been an opportunity if we'd caught it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 5:45. Five-forty-five doesn't do me any good, Lewis. Five-forty-five, network news is in makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got 14 people working for you. Did any of them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, do I have to be here for this meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. It's the evening news. It was buried as the third story--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --It's got a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney was at a protest rally where they burned a flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 13 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the Department of Commerce. Anti-apartheid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see if I've got this: The third story on the news tonight was that someone I didn't know 13 years ago, when I wasn't President, participated in a demonstration where no laws were being broken in protest of something that so many people were against it doesn't exist anymore? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out of curiosity, what was the fourth story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I think it's important, when we deal with it, that we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to get us to swing at a pitch in the dirt. No one ever wins these fights. It'll go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that's the wisest--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw...hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's already distracting you. Why don't you let A.J. and Lewis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you reminded me, I'm supposed to have dinner with Sydney tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY and BETH stand in front of a full-length mirror. SYDNEY's holding a dress to herself to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrific, Beth. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm loaning you clothes. I thought you owned every piece of clothing there was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work clothes. I always have dinner at the White House wearing a suit. I thought a dress would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, try it on. I brought earrings, too. The PHONE RINGS. SYDNEY answers it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying on dresses. How do you feel about leather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD's on the phone to SYDNEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel terrible, but I have to cancel our date tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've gotta go to St. Louis and avert a massive airline strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, if I had a nickel for every time I heard that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for understanding. I'll call you tonight SHEPHERD hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I hate doing that. She was trying on dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell any girl I'm going out with to assume that all plans are soft until she receives confirmation 30 minutes beforehand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they find this romantic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I say it with a great deal of charm. SHEPHERD sees something out the window and gets excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Look! There it is! Carmen's House of Flowers! We gotta stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get her flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke our date. This is what men do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what men do. I know no men who do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop, I'm gonna hop out at that flower shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna hop out, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's not hopping. Sir, no hopping. Stay in the car. I'll get the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's not personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the agents do a security sweep. We don't know who's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think there's a florist who's planning an assassination on the off-chance that I'd be stopping by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible. SHEPHERD hops out of the car. AGENT COOPER trails after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD's sudden decision sets off a chain reaction of Secret Service activity to accommodate the change of plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high school GIRL is behind the counter, talking to a fr on the phone. Her back is to the door when SHEPHERD walks with a couple of SECRET SERVICE AGENTS scrambling to keep SHEPHERD begins surveying the various flowers that are be the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the basketball game...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, at the game. I'm telling you, Kiki wasn't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shepherd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be right with you. The GIRL notices, and the receiver falls from her hand as she stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the GIRL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't know if you're the one I talked to on the phone... Virginia, dogwood, the President ...any of it ring a-- And apparently it does, because the GIRL faints and falls the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same girl. She remembers me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and I'm glad to see ol' Andy's got himself a girl. APPLAUSE and appreciative LAUGHTER from a CROWD as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUMSON is speaking to a black-tie fund-raiser for the REPUBLICAN LEADERSHIP ALLIANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind she's the hired gun of an ultra-liberal political action committee. The crowd's getting into it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that the President takes the Fifth anytime a reporter has the temerity to ask a question about a woman in a position to exert enormous influence over a huge range of issues. A wave building--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that this woman's idea of how to unwind at the end of a tough day is by getting together with her ACLU pals and setting American flags on fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMSON FAMILY glows from a TELEVISION in the corner. LEWIS and ROBIN react to the news highlight reel of that day's screw-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction from the White House. SHEPHERD's off in a corner, talking on the phone. The Presidential Suite has been turned into the St. Louis Ova Office for the night as STAFFERS zigzag around room servi tables during the late-night preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do Lewis and Robin think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutus and Cassius? They want me to get into the character debate and mix it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis and Robin are very smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS and ROBIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney says you guys are really stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting through the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS and ROBIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's questioning your loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I question it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, here comes my favorite part. He's referring to RUMSON on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Bob Rumson, and I'm running for President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing he cleared that up, 'cause the crowd was gettin' ready to buy some AMWAY products.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His number are climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney, his number have nowhere to go but up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine. We'll be back up in the 60's once I get the votes for the crime bill. (beat; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, what're you doing this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some work I was gonna bring home. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The negotiations are going pretty well here. It looks like the nation's going to keep on flying. Lucy's sleeping over at a friend's house Saturday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been to Camp David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camp David? Sure. I used to go there all the time, but then they changed chefs and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sass, right? You're sassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a car pick you up Saturday morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered STAFF and MARINE PERSONNEL hold their hats to t heads against the wind that MARINE-1 kicks up as it touch down on the helicopter pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY, nose pressed against the window, is drinking it i SHEPHERD is finishing up a crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever get used to helicopters dropping you off at your front door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many "e"s in "kaleidoscope"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHERD and SYDNEY are lounging in front of a fireplace, having hot cups of something alcoholic. SYDNEY is reading book. SHEPHERD is running through satellite TV channels, searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at your college transcripts. This isn't human. Nobody gets this many "A's." You were like a Stepford student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still reading that ridiculous biography?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I finished Andrew Shepherd: Road to the White House. Now I'm onto Shepherd: The Early Years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-trillion-dollar communications system at my disposal, you'd think I'd be able to find out if the Packers won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Andy...C-minus in Women's Studies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...that course wasn't about what I thought it was gonna be about. SHEPHERD has landed on a news station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for his routine physical exam. Doctors at Bethesda Naval Hospital pronounced President Shepherd in excellent health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? Let's see some scores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the President spent the day at Camp David, G.O.P. presidential hopeful Robert Rumson continued his attacks on President Shepherd's character. During the Saturday morning news program Capitol Review with Kenneth Michaels, Senator Rumson suggested that GDC political director Sydney Ellen Wade, whose personal relationship with the President has been causing the White House headaches over the past two months, may have traded sexual favors for key votes in the Virginia State Legislature while lobbying for the Virginia Teachers Association. The NEWS PROGRAM goes to the segment showing RUMSON and MICHAELS on that morning's show. SHEPHERD and SYDNEY sit watch...knowing they're about to take a punch...powerless stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) Wait a minute, Senator--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --'cause that's a heck of an accusation to make, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not making an acc-- let me be very clear. I'm not making an accusation. I am saying when we hear one thing, we dismiss it. We hear two, we dismiss it. But when several, several well- respected members and former members of the Virginia State House--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give us names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --each of their own accord, comes to me and expresses concern over the woman standing next to -- I don't even know, do we call her the First Mistress? When several--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. He's making this up as he goes along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry about this, Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. My father heard that. SHEPHERD clicks off the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta tell him to turn a deaf ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father doesn't have a deaf ear. He hears fine out of both. So do I. So does my sister, so do my friends. You're the only one who seems to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney, I can't challenge the school bully to a fight just because he picked on my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you to. I can take care of myself. This isn't about me. How can you keep quiet? How do you have patience for people who claim they love America but clearly can't stand Americans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have one more election left, Sydney. I don't have the luxury of losing my patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say something, but I'm gonna fumble it a little bit, so I'd just like you to wait till I'm done before you respond. I'm in love with you. I'm certain of it. And I want to be with you more than anything. But maybe things would be better for you if I disappeared for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things will be better when I pass a crime bill. And Sydney, if you disappeared, I'd find you. He goes to kiss her, she responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official White House Christmas Tree is glimmering for TOURISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An informal Christmas party is underway with maybe 20 GUE some of them familiar faces. SHEPHERD and a GREEN-BLAZERED MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, militant women are out to destroy college football in this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a fact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been following this situation down in Atlanta? These women want parity for girls' softball, field hockey, volleyball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm not mistaken, Gill, I think the courts ruled on Title 9 about 20 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, but now I'm saying these women want that law enforced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a world gone mad, Gill. LEWIS, KODAK and ROBIN stand huddled with cups of eggnog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The country has mood swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mood swings? Nineteen post-graduate degrees in mathematics and you explain going from a 63 to a 46 percent approval rating in 5 weeks on mood swings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could explain it better, but I'd need charts and graphs and an easel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas, we haven't slept in three years. Can't we forget work for one night and take this moment to enjoy each other as friends? It's Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you didn't get the memo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause your father's President, does he automatically get to be on money? LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think only if he's a really good President. A.J. spots SYDNEY as she walks through the doorway and co over to her. She seems a bit agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sydney, Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, A.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got stuck on DePont Circle. I can never remember which lane I'm supposed to take. Then I got cut off by this idiot cab driver who starts screaming at me like it's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd, relax. It's Christmas. SHEPHERD joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Syd. Get stuck on DuPont Circle again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not funny. I hate that place. Can't you declare it a Federal Disaster Area or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing up on the Hill, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...I had a terrible meeting today. Totally lost my cool with McSorley, McCluskey and Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to see the Motown Three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pitched 'em the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its merits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman knows no fear. She'd lobby the Carolinas to the American Lung Association.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in good company. I sat with 'em a week ago. They told me there was nothing on the President's domestic agenda they were more committed to defeating than the crime bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, congratulations, fellas, you're outta the cellar. McSorley told me the only thing on the President's domestic agenda they were more committed to defeating than the crime bill was the fossil fuel package. This catches SHEPHERD and A.J. by surprise--like accident drawing to an inside straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? SYDNEY isn't aware she's said anything of particular consequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not kidding. It's funny that he used the same words. A.J. and SHEPHERD are trying to study the situation witho giving anything away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the Pep Boys know too many words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a drink and shake this off. When I come back, I'll have Christmas spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was...I was thinking about-- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a minute. She goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did what I think just happened, just happen? Did the GDC's political director just tell the President and the White House Chief of Staff that there are three votes on the crime bill that can be bought by stickin' the fossil fuel package in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the GDC's political director didn't tell us anything. Sydney Wade told her boyfriend and her boyfriend's best friend that she had a lousy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't change the facts, Mr. President. If Sydney gets her 24 votes and we're three short, there's some maneuvering to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a promise, A.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a deal, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made it with Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it with the GDC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, this is all academic anyway. We're not going to need those votes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your approval rating drops any more, things are gonna get tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS sits with a Congressman's aide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hearing rumors that your boss is wavering on the crime bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't believe rumors, Lewis, you know this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, though. My boss is starting to waver on the crime bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lunchtime crowd is doing business over white wine, oyst and cobb salads. SYDNEY, a CONGRESSMAN, and his LEGISLATI AIDE are going at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney, everybody cares about the environment during a phone survey. On election day, nobody gives a damn. That's, that's why you have a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congressman Pennybaker, on election day, people give a damn about what I tell them to give a damn about. And that's why I have a job. (offering the bread basket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want another roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is on the phone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the INTERNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got Pennybaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Good job! DAVID rips off the top sheet of the tote board, which now reads "5 Votes in 14 Days."

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSMAN MILLMAN'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: MILLMAN is walking on a treadmill while LEWIS stands by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congressman, it was our understanding that we had your support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I like your boy. Always have. But for God's sake, kid, does the woman have to spend the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERNS photocopying, clipping, stamping, crunching numbe drinking coffee...DAVID is on an extension, listening to SYDNEY's final pitch over the phone. The tote board reads: "3 Votes in 5 Days."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the full backing of the White House, Katherine. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
